etymology.description: 下(下) (xià, "below; down") + 班(班) (bān, "shift; work") = to get off work -> when the work shift or period is over
etymology.interpretation: 下(下) (xià, "below; down") indicates finishing or concluding a task, while 班(班) (bān, "shift; work") refers to a work period. Together, 下班 (xiàbān, "to get off work") describes the action of completing your work shift and leaving your workplace.

examples.chinese: 我下午五点下班(我下午五點下班)。
examples.english: I get off work at five in the afternoon.

examples.chinese: 今天工作很辛苦(今天工作很辛苦)，下班后他喝了一杯咖啡(下班後他喝了一杯咖啡)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān gōngzuò hěn xīnkǔ, xiàbān hòu tā hē le yī bēi kāfēi.
examples.english: Today work is arduous; after getting off work, he had a cup of coffee.

examples.chinese: 公交车缓缓驶来(公交車緩緩駛來)，下班的人群开始涌动(下班的人群開始湧動)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiāo chē huǎn huǎn shǐ lái, xiàbān de rénqún kāishǐ yǒngdòng.
examples.english: The bus slowly arrives, and the crowd getting off work begins to surge.
